headline.seo: Woman Accuses Starlin Castro of the Chicago Cubs

docs.snippet: In her first elite-level competition since coming out of retirement, Janet Evans, 40, qualified for the Olympic trials in the 400-meter freestyle....
docs.abstract: Janet Evans, 40-year-old former Olympic champion and world-record holder, swimming in her first elite-level competition since coming out of retirement, qualifies for the Olympic trials in the 400-meter freestyle.
docs.lead_paragraph: In her first elite-level competition since coming out of retirement, Janet Evans, 40, qualified for the Olympic trials in the 400-meter freestyle.

headline.print_headline: A Champion of France’s Downtrodden, With Limits of His Own
headline.seo: Jean-Christophe Parisot, a Champion of France’s Downtrodden
headline.main: A Champion of France’s Downtrodden, With Limits of His Own

docs.snippet: As a deputy prefect who is mostly paralyzed as a result of a rare genetic degenerative disease, Jean-Christophe Parisot fights for immigrants, the elderly and the poor....
docs.abstract: Saturday Profile of Jean-Christophe Parisot, one of the highest-ranking civil servants in region of Languedoc-Roussillon, France, who suffers from rare degenerative disease limb-girdle muscular dystrophy, which has, so far, paralyzed his torso and most of his limbs.
docs.lead_paragraph: As a deputy prefect who is mostly paralyzed as a result of a rare genetic degenerative disease, Jean-Christophe Parisot fights for immigrants, the elderly and the poor.

headline.print_headline: Fifteen Minutes Faster And Four Years Wiser
headline.seo: Desiree Davila, 28, Has Become a Favorite at U.S. Marathon Trials
headline.main: Fifteen Minutes Faster and Four Years Wiser

docs.snippet: Desiree Davila, an also-ran at the 2008 qualifying race, enters Saturday’s U.S. Olympic marathon trials with the fastest qualifying time, 2:22:38....
docs.abstract: Marathoner Desiree Davila, an also-ran at the 2008 qualifying race, enters the US Olympic marathon trials with the fastest qualifying time at 2 hours 22 minutes and 38 seconds.
docs.lead_paragraph: Desiree Davila, an also-ran at the 2008 qualifying race, enters Saturday’s U.S. Olympic marathon trials with the fastest qualifying time, 2:22:38.

headline.print_headline: Beneath a Deeply Silly Campaign, a Deeply Serious Performer
headline.seo: Stephen Colbert Stirs Up Political Campaign and Media
headline.main: Beneath a Deeply Silly Campaign, a Deeply Serious Performer

docs.snippet: In his bid to join the Republican presidential contest, Stephen Colbert is a serious performer playing a silly character, while the media and political world are deeply silly but pretending to be serious....
docs.abstract: Stephen Colbert's bid to join the Republican presidential contest contrasts how he is a serious performer playing a silly character, while the media and political world is deeply silly but pretending to be serious.
docs.lead_paragraph: In his bid to join the Republican presidential contest, Stephen Colbert is a serious performer playing a silly character, while the media and political world are deeply silly but pretending to be serious.

docs.snippet: As the uproar over his last-minute grants of clemency continued, former Gov. Haley Barbour showed no sign of backing down on Friday....
docs.abstract: Former Mississippi Gov Haley Barbour defends his decision to grant clemency, and mostly full pardons, to 215 convicts in his last days in office, despite uproar over the decision.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the uproar over his last-minute grants of clemency continued, former Gov. Haley Barbour showed no sign of backing down on Friday.

docs.snippet: The state appeals court on Friday ordered the release of the billionaire owner of the Ambassador Bridge, which connects Detroit to Canada, after he spent a night in jail for civil contempt....
docs.lead_paragraph: The state appeals court on Friday ordered the release of the billionaire owner of the Ambassador Bridge, which connects Detroit to Canada, after he spent a night in jail for civil contempt.

headline.seo: A New Anti-Alcohol Campaign in New York

docs.snippet: Theodore Roosevelt, when he was police commissioner, tried to crack down on New Yorkers’ alcohol consumption. It didn’t go well....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Richard Zacks holds that New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's current attempt to curb excessive alcohol consumption in the city recalls the unsuccessful 1895 liquor crackdown of then-police commissioner Theodore Roosevelt.
docs.lead_paragraph: Theodore Roosevelt, when he was police commissioner, tried to crack down on New Yorkers’ alcohol consumption. It didn’t go well.
